title: Posibles ataques de "represalia" en la Convención Nacional Demócrata son motivo de preocupación tras el intento de magnicidio de Trump, según una evaluación federal
text: gettyimages-2161768669 (CNN) -- Los funcionarios de seguridad de Estados Unidos están en alerta ante posibles ataques de represalia contra los demócratas tras el intento de magnicidio contra el expresidente Donald Trump, según un nuevo informe de inteligencia obtenido por CNN. La evaluación de la amenaza, preparada conjuntamente por el FBI, el Departamento de Seguridad Nacional y otras agencias, incluida la policía local de Illinois, describe varias preocupaciones potenciales de seguridad en torno a la próxima Convención Nacional Demócrata en Chicago. “Lo que vi me avergonzó”: el jefe del Servicio Secreto abordará los fallos de seguridad en la audiencia sobre el intento de magnicidio de Trump "El FBI y el DHS siguen preocupados por la posibilidad de que se produzcan actos de violencia de seguimiento o represalia tras el intento de magnicidio de (Trump) el 13 de julio de 2024, sobre todo teniendo en cuenta que algunas personas en algunas comunidades en línea han amenazado, alentado o hecho referencia a actos de violencia en respuesta al intento de asesinato", dice la evaluación, señalando que las agencias no han identificado ninguna amenaza específica y creíble. Aunque el motivo del atacante que disparó contra Trump sigue siendo un misterio para los investigadores, el boletín dice que "los temas política y socialmente divisivos han incitado a la violencia en el pasado", y añade que algunos radicales "verán las tensiones políticas y sociales como una oportunidad para usar o promover la violencia para promover sus objetivos ideológicos". La evaluación de los servicios de inteligencia es habitual en las grandes concentraciones consideradas acontecimientos especiales de seguridad nacional por el secretario del DHS, e incluye muchos de los problemas de seguridad expuestos en un informe conjunto de las fuerzas de seguridad federales publicado el mes pasado antes de la Convención Nacional Republicana de Milwaukee. CNN se puso en contacto con el DHS y el FBI para recabar sus comentarios sobre la evaluación de amenazas. El atacante de Trump buscó detalles del asesinato de JFK y voló un dron cerca del lugar del mitin de campaña, dice el FBI La convención demócrata comienza el 19 de agosto y se espera que atraiga a más de 50.000 visitantes al centro de Chicago, entre ellos numerosas personalidades como el presidente Joe Biden, la vicepresidenta Kamala Harris y una serie de líderes electos de todo el país. El acto se celebra tras numerosos y preocupantes incidentes de seguridad ocurridos recientemente en todo el mundo en relación con concentraciones masivas de personas, como el ataque contra Trump en un mitin de campaña en Butler, Pensilvania, en el que murió un miembro del público y otros resultaron heridos, entre ellos el expresidente. Ese incidente provocó críticas bipartidistas contra el Servicio Secreto y el hecho de que no se asegurara adecuadamente un edificio cercano a la gran concentración utilizado por el atacante para disparar contra la multitud. El miércoles, las autoridades de Austria anunciaron la detención de tres presuntos simpatizantes de ISIS que supuestamente planeaban un atentado suicida en un concierto de Taylor Swift. Los funcionarios de seguridad creen que los individuos se radicalizaron en Internet, y la preocupación por la seguridad del evento provocó la cancelación de tres conciertos de Swift. ANÁLISIS | La supuesta conspiración terrorista contra Taylor Swift encaja en una preocupante tendencia de ISIS a atacar a adolescentes en internet En su evaluación de inteligencia para la Convención Nacional Demócrata, el FBI y el DHS afirman que la amenaza terrorista más importante a la que se enfrenta el evento procede de extremistas "incluidos delincuentes solitarios, que cometen actos violentos para promover una amplia gama de creencias y reivindicaciones ideológicas antigubernamentales, políticas, raciales, étnicas, religiosas, sociales o personales". Las agencias señalan que grupos como al Qaeda e ISIS "han alentado ataques contra Occidente y han aprovechado las redes sociales para amplificar sus mensajes para inspirar ataques en la Patria". "Creo que todo el mundo tiene la sensación de que las amenazas son reales. No se trata de un ejercicio académico. Estamos planificando para las posibilidades del mundo real", declaró anteriormente Jeff Burnside, coordinador del Servicio Secreto para la convención demócrata, sobre los preparativos de seguridad. Según la evaluación, las tensiones en el Medio Oriente tras el atentado terrorista de Hamas contra Israel del año pasado también podrían alimentar la preocupación por la seguridad pública en la próxima convención de Chicago. Desde el atentado del 7 de octubre, las fuerzas del orden han observado un aumento de las amenazas a las comunidades judía, musulmana y árabe en Estados Unidos, "incluidos informes de agresiones físicas, amenazas de bomba y llamamientos en internet a cometer atentados con víctimas en masa", dice la evaluación de la amenaza. "A medida que la retórica violenta y la desinformación asociada con el conflicto se comparten en línea, seguimos preocupados por el potencial de violencia dirigida denunciable motivada por agravios exacerbados por el conflicto". Como ha informado previamente CNN, las recientes manifestaciones en todo el país contra el apoyo del Gobierno de Biden a la guerra de Israel en Gaza han suscitado comparaciones con la convención demócrata de 1968, en la que se produjeron violentos enfrentamientos entre la policía de Chicago y manifestantes contrarios a la guerra de Vietnam. A poco más de una semana del comienzo de la convención, las fuerzas del orden de Chicago han estado realizando simulacros sobre una amplia gama de posibles escenarios, como protestas violentas, extracción de personas de multitudes hostiles, emergencias médicas y otros. -- Sean Lyngaas y John Miller de CNN contribuyeron con este reportaje.

author: Víctor P. Currás,Borja Melchor
title: La estancia media en hoteles de Vigo cae a su mínimo histórico: 1,5 días por viajero
text:
La estancia media en hoteles de Vigo cae a su mínimo histórico: 1,5 días por viajero
El récord de visitantes en el primer trimestre contrasta con la caída en las pernoctas en la ciudad y su duración
El aumento de peregrinos y las mejoras en las conexiones por tren y avión, culpables del cambio
El turismo de Vigo continúa viviendo una época de cambios profundos. Tras el gran salto al top-5 del noroeste peninsular logrado durante el último lustro o los récords en el mercado internacional tras la pandemia llega un nuevo paradigma: la caída en las estancias medias en los hoteles. Y es que a pesar del récord histórico de viajeros registrado durante el primer trimestre (103.864 y una subida del 18%), éste no ha venido con uno de pernoctaciones. La Coyuntura Turística Hotelera del INE cifró en 162.722 las noches hospedadas en la ciudad, por lo que la duración media ha caído a apenas 1,57 días por visitante, tocando fondo en marzo con 1,53 jornadas.
La cifra de este último mes supone prácticamente la mitad que la estancia media máxima registrada por el ente estatal: 2,96 días en noviembre de 2020, con una décima menos en enero de 2021 en plena tercera ola del coronavirus. En aquel momento los desplazamientos se limitaron a trabajadores que debían estar varios días en la urbe, reduciendo al mínimo los de ocio.
Sin embargo, tras el fin de la pandemia se estabilizó de nuevo en las 1,9 pernoctas por viajero hasta que en primavera de 2024 irrumpió otro factor: los peregrinos que aprovechan su paso por Vigo para alojarse en un lugar con más comodidades que los albergues. Durante esos meses, la cifra cayó hasta los 1,7 días, los más bajos desde que hay registros.
Aumento de los peregrinos
Hasta el 29 de abril un total de 11.411 personas habían llegado a la Oficina del Peregrino ubicada en la zona vieja de la capital gallega a través de Camino Portugués da Costa. En la subida del 16% respecto al mismo periodo del año anterior sobresalen los viajeros internacionales (83% del total) con Alemania (1.689) y Estados Unidos (1.075) a la cabeza.
De todos ellos, casi la mitad comenzaron en Vigo o Baiona, aunque la opción líder sigue siendo Oporto con 3.067 fieles. Es por ello que ni siquiera el auge de esta ruta —junto al Portugués ya suman el 36% de todos los caminos jacobeos— justifica el cambio en la duración de las visitas.
Y es que en estos tres primeros meses del año han sido los españoles los que han aportado de forma significativa a la industria hotelera viguesa. Los 77.966 turistas (un 26,9% más que en 2024) antes de Semana Santa compensaron el ligero retroceso en los extranjeros. Tras casi 24 meses de récords consecutivos, la aportación foránea se quedó en 25.898; pasando su cuota de casi el 40% durante el pasado otoño a menos del 30% este año.
Las principales causas de este cambio en la tendencia llegan en la forma que tienen los visitantes de llegar a Vigo, especialmente en cuanto a rapidez, precio y flexibilidad. La oferta de trenes con dos AVE y un Avlo a Madrid (aunque con tiempos lejos de lo prometido) y las rutas aéreas a seis destinos nacionales durante este invierno habrían «acercado» la ciudad para escapadas de uno o dos días en ocio y trabajo.
Sin los pisos turísticos
Conviene destacar que el INE solamente tiene en cuenta los establecimientos hoteleros como tal. Es por ello que en estas cifras quedan fuera los miles de visitantes que se hospedan en el área metropolitana o en las casi 3.000 viviendas de uso turístico que hay registradas.
Cíes cuelga el cartel de completo los días 2 y 3 de mayo
El Parque Nacional de Illas Atlánticas volverá a colgar el cartel de completo durante los próximos días. La coincidencia del festivo nacional del jueves 1 de mayo (Día del Trabajador) y el festivo regional del viernes 2 de mayo en la Comunidad de Madrid ha disparado las reservas, agotándose ya el cupo de 450 autorizaciones diarias para visitar las Islas Cíes los días viernes 2 y sábado 3.
Para dar respuesta a la creciente demanda en este puente tan importante en nuestra comunidad, Mar de Ons también pondrá en marcha viajes a la Isla de Ons desde el puerto de Vigo, dando continuidad al operativo habitual de primavera y ofreciendo a los visitantes una alternativa igual de atractiva en el corazón del Parque Nacional Marítimo-Terrestre das Illas Atlánticas. Las salidas a la Isla de Ons se realizarán el viernes 2 y el sábado 3 de mayo desde Vigo a las 12:15 horas permitiendo a los viajeros también disfrutar de una visita guiada en este entorno natural privilegiado.

author: Marion Scott
title: Shamed Catholic priest Joseph Dunne finally jailed for sexual abuse after appeal, but former church adviser questions why getting justice took so long
text: A Catholic priest who preyed on girls and vulnerable young women for decades has finally been jailed after his international web of abuse and deceit was exposed by The Sunday Post. [Father Joseph Dunne](https://www.sundaypost.com/fp/victim-criticises-church-failures-over-sex-abuse/) sexually assaulted and harassed a string of young women and girls in Glasgow, Los Angeles and Ireland during the 1980s – but church authorities repeatedly failed to stop him. Earlier this year he was convicted of sexually assaulting a young woman in Ireland, but received just a four-year suspended sentence. Last week Dunne, 82, [was finally jailed](https://www.independent.ie/regionals/offaly/news/former-offaly-priest-who-sexually-assaulted-vulnerable-woman-is-jailed-after-his-sentence-is-overturned/a96808316.html) for two years after Ireland’s Court of Appeal overturned the earlier sentence. [Dunne’s abuse](https://www.sundaypost.com/fp/the-priest-used-to-ask-me-to-wear-short-skirts-and-invite-me-to-the-seaside-he-came-to-our-door-once-but-mum-shouted-leave-my-daughter-alone/) went unchecked because, despite numerous victims and their families complaining about him to church authorities, he was simply allowed to move to new parishes. And it was only when Dunne, known in his hometown in County Offaly, Ireland, as “Father Joe” was tracked down and exposed by The Sunday Post, in January 2019, that police there finally acted to prosecute him for sexually abusing a rape victim. Following our expose, police found letters to Dunne’s Bishop in Ireland detailing a series of violent sexual attacks on one extremely vulnerable victim which began while he was taking her to a rape centre for counselling. Joseph Dunne’s victims Last night Alan Draper, the former church adviser who has supported thousands of Scotland’s survivors of historical abuse, said: “At long last Dunne is where he should be, behind bars. Without being exposed by The Sunday Post, it is doubtful Dunne would ever have been prosecuted at all. “I hope that news of his incarceration will give some measure of comfort to those affected by his despicable behaviour over many years. There still remains a number of questions over how this man was able to continue operating as a priest, moving around from country to country, parish to parish, despite the serious accusations being made against him over a period of many years.” Draper, a former director of social work who was called in by the Catholic church to advise them on how to handle accusations of sexual abuse, had written repeatedly to bishops in three of the dioceses where Dunne operated. He said: “I believe the church still has those questions to answer, particularly over how this was ever allowed to happen and continue happening for so many years? If the correct action had been taken the first-time accusations were made, it is quite likely that other alleged victims would have been spared. Accountability must be addressed.” Dunne was sacked by the Archdiocese of Glasgow in 1988 after complaints about his behaviour by two schoolgirls. He moved to Los Angeles and established himself at two new churches, where he was later accused of inappropriate behaviour by two young parishioners. Dunne worked at Our Lady of Perpetual Help in Santa Clarita when he insisted on playing games of “tickle in the dark” when she was just 12 years old. One of those girls, Amanda Bare, told The Sunday Post: “I vividly remember his favourite game was chase and tickle and he kept wanting to play it in the dark.” Dunne was eventually banned from the family’s home when her mother witnessed his behaviour, and she reported him to the local bishop for attempting to “groom” her daughter. Dunne was questioned by police, but no prosecution went ahead. Amanda said: “It’s been a dark shadow hanging over me. Because of it I’ve experienced serious trust issues. It’s hung over relationships, my work and career. It’s always there.” After leaving Glasgow, and before moving to LA, Dunne returned home to Co Offaly. It was then, in 1989, that Dunne befriended a young woman who was a patient in a hospital he visited, where she was recovering from being abused by another person. She was due to attend counselling, which was difficult for her to access due to her rural location, and Dunne offered to drive her to the Rape Crisis Centre. During several of those trips, Dunne indecently assaulted her. After a number of assaults, the woman avoided Dunne, but forgave him after he apologised. He then assaulted her again. Dunne left for the US, but after his return, she saw that he was being allowed to stand in at funerals and masses. At that point she wrote to her local bishop but heard no more until Irish police launched an investigation into Dunne in 2019 – at which point her letters were found. Impact of abuse In a statement to the court, she outlined the devastating effects his abuse has had on her life in relation to relationships, her mental health and employment. She said she feels she will grow old on her own as she can not trust anyone. At the Court of Appeal in Dublin on Monday, Mr Justice John Edwards said the “violence” of the sexual offences were “terrifying” for the woman, had long-lasting effects on her and merited a custodial sentence. The judge said Dunne’s subsequent “purported apology” to the victim for his behaviour towards her before abusing her again amounted to “weasel words”. “He exploited his chaplaincy role to secure an opportunity to abuse his victim. This was not one-off offending either,” he added. In re-sentencing Dunne, Mr Justice Edwards said a headline sentence of six years was appropriate and discounted two years to reflect the guilty pleas and Dunne’s personal circumstances. In taking Dunne’s care for his elderly sister into account, Mr Justice Edwards said he would suspend a further two years of the sentence for two years, leaving him with a two-year jail term to be served. The Sunday Post [confronted Dunne at his home in Ireland in 2019](https://www.sundaypost.com/fp/the-priest-used-to-ask-me-to-wear-short-skirts-and-invite-me-to-the-seaside-he-came-to-our-door-once-but-mum-shouted-leave-my-daughter-alone/), when he said: “I’ve done nothing wrong. My conscience is clear.” Earlier this year he again refused to speak to reporters. The Archdiocese of Glasgow said: “We welcome the decision of the judges in Dublin to send Joseph Dunne to prison for his despicable crimes and hope that this will give some comfort to the victim of his abuse. “Over recent years the Archdiocese has sought to offer what support it can to the woman who has had the courage to come forward and make known Joseph Dunne’s offences. Sadly, while we acknowledge her pain and suffering and offer our deepest apology, we know that the harm she has suffered cannot be undone. “Throughout this case the Archdiocese has cooperated with the police in Scotland and in Ireland. We are determined to root out any form of abuse and repeat our apology to all those affected by this or other such cases. “Canonical proceedings against Joseph Dunne had to await the conclusion of these proceedings in the Irish courts. Now that the Court of Appeal has reached a final decision we will report back to Rome. “Anyone who is affected by this or who has any concerns about safeguarding should contact the Archdiocese or the police.” How we tracked him down A single word, Scotland, tucked away in a sea of thousands of words and places, sealed the fate of vile predator Father Joseph Dunne. But for that word, the manipulative priest would never have been brought to justice. He had already remained free for four decades, preying on girls and young women in three countries despite allegations against him in Scotland dating back to 1988. But the police were never told at that time, allowing his reign of terror to only end last week when he was jailed after a five-year Sunday Post campaign to bring justice to victims. Dunne first came to our attention in 2018 when his name was published by the Diocese of Los Angeles, almost hidden away amongst the list of hundreds of other priests accused of historical sexual abuse. With no other clues to his background, it took a deep search of old Catholic Directories at Glasgow’s Mitchell Library, to find records detailing how Dunne was moved around five city parishes after being ordained at Waterford Cathedral in 1975. He first served as a priest at St James’s Crookston, moving to St Lawrence’s, Drumchapel, until 1978 and then St Bartholomew’s, Castlemilk. He was then sent to St Paul’s, Whiteinch, in 1985 and then to St Mary The Immaculate in Pollokshaws. According to the Church, in 1988 he was “sacked” after allegations of abuse and inappropriate behaviour emerged, claiming Dunne went to the US despite the intervention of former Cardinal Thomas Winning. US church hierarchy allowed the abuser to work at a parish in Santa Clarita. US lawyer Patrick Wall, an expert in clerical abuse, helped us trace the parish where Dunne served, and weeks of pouring through documents and online forums allowed us to find a mother and daughter whose accusations led to him quitting the US. After searching across Ireland, using local telephone books, we painstakingly called hundreds of numbers before finally finding Dunne hiding in the quaint rural town of Geashill in County Offaly where he was known to everyone as “Father Joe”. When we confronted Dunne at his home, he called victims “liars” and threatened to call the police. As a result of our extensive investigation, numerous calls were made to the police and Bishops across Ireland alerting them to the allegations made against Dunne. Police following up on our investigation finally acted on letters from Dunne’s Irish victim detailing how the vile priest had repeatedly attacked her as she sought counselling from a rape centre in 1989. Last year the brave victim found the strength to give evidence against Dunne. The priest believed he had escaped…but he had not taken into account our determination to see him brought to justice. I don’t think he realises the harm he has caused us A victim who was groomed by Joseph Dunne when he was her parish priest has welcomed his prison sentence. The woman, now in her 50s and married with children, was a teenager when Dunne offered her money to go with him to the seaside, organised tennis matches and suggested that she wore a short tennis skirt. She decided not to go to the police, because she could not face giving evidence in court. Instead she reported her concerns to the Archdiocese of Glasgow, but her concerns were dismissed, with Dunne being moved to another parish. He was only dismissed after further complaints about his conduct involving two other girls. “This man is an internationally-protected paedophile who is finally, after decades of abuse, going to jail. “This is the best news I have heard in years. He deserves to be locked up and I don’t imagine prison is a kind or forgiving place for sex offenders in their 80s, especially those who abuse the trust of children. “When I heard earlier this year that he had got a suspended sentence I felt despair at how the justice system could protect abusers for decades. “I thank the Irish justice system for finally seeking justice.” She added that she is not being vitriolic. “I don’t generally like the concept of sending people to prison because it is brutal but it will be a chance for him to reflect on what he has done. “I honestly don’t think he realises the harm he causes women and girls. “He had a terrible reputation for inappropriate behaviour with teenagers in our parish, St Paul’s in Whiteinch, Glasgow. “He pretended to be helpful and nice to gain access and the trust of teenagers and their families. “But I hated his advances and did not want to be alone with him. “Grooming wasn’t known about back then but it is now obvious that there was a pattern to the people he chose – young or vulnerable. “Eventually, when he turned up at our house my mother told him to go away and leave her daughter alone. “People were powerless to report sex offenders back then as they felt no one would have believed them. “When he was moved on from our parish we were told he had been sent on retreat to Ireland as some kind of self reflection. “I want people to address the serious issue of why this man was left to continue doing this. “Children and others who are groomed and avoid sexual assault should be classed as near misses and we must intervene before someone is assaulted or worse.” She adds she has gone from being a devout Catholic to leaving the church. author: Hanna Carvalho
title: Queijo pode ser aliado na redução do colesterol alto e bom para o coração; entenda | Bem Estar | EM OFF
text: A nutricionista irlandesa [ Emma Feeney,](https://emoff.correiobraziliense.com.br/bem-estar/) que lidera pesquisa sobre colesterol do [Instituto de Alimentação e Saúde da Universidade de Dublin](http://instagram.com/portalemoff), contou em entrevista ao portal britânico Daily Mail que incluir derivados do leite na dieta, a depender da quantidade, pode diminuir o excesso de colesterol circulando no organismo. “Menos gordura saturada entra na corrente sanguínea quando se comem queijos integrais. Parece que parte da gordura da alimentação se liga aos ricos bolsões de cálcio presentes no alimento e se tornam uma espécie de sabão. Assim, eles não são absorvidos pelo intestino e podem ser eliminados nas fezes”, explica a especialista. Vilão ou não? Um estudo realizado pela especialista em 2018, mostrou que o consumo de cerca de 42 gramas de cheddar maduro — que é diferente das versões industrializadas do Brasil, passando por um processo mais artesanal — levou a uma diminuição dos níveis de colesterol ruim no corpo dos participantes. Além disso, um outro estudo também realizado pela nutricionista em janeiro de 2023, mostrou que o [cheddar enriquecido com altas doses de cálcio](https://emoff.correiobraziliense.com.br/curiosidades/) traz benefícios no combate ao colesterol. A profissional pontua que, quanto mais cálcio, melhor para o combate a altos níveis dessa substância no organismo. Como escolher o queijo correto? É necessário ter cuidado na hora da escolha de qual queijo consumir. Cerca de 100 gramas de muçarela ou de queijo branco possuem 0,7 g de cálcio. A mesma quantidade de parmesão tem 1,1 g e ele é o campeão do cálcio. Em média, pessoas entre 19 e 50 anos precisam de 1g de cálcio por dia para satisfazer as necessidades diárias desse nutriente. No entanto, esse cuidado é primordial antes de levar o queijo para a alimentação diária. Em entrevista ao Daily Mail, o cardiologista [ Oliver Guttmann ](https://emoff.correiobraziliense.com.br/bem-estar/o-que-acontece-com-seu-corpo-se-comer-2-ovos-todos-os-dias-descubra/)aponta que boa parte dos queijos são ricos em conservantes e possuem muito sal, o que pode anular os benefícios da ingestão de cálcio. “Pesquisas sugerem que até 40g por dia de queijo provavelmente farão muito bem para você, mas o ideal é escolher queijos com pouco sal e com poucas calorias”, defende o médico. 11 benefícios do queijo à saúde - O queijo contém todos os aminoácidos necessários para o nosso corpo funcionar corretamente. - O queijo é uma fonte importante de cálcio, um elemento essencial para a saúde dos ossos e dentes, para além disso a absorção de cálcio é favorecida pelas proteínas contidas no queijo. - Já dissemos que o queijo é benéfico para os ossos porque eles são ricos em cálcio, mas também o consumo de queijo tem um efeito positivo na luta contra a osteoporose e outras doenças ósseas. - O queijo não só fortalece os dentes, graças à grande quantidade de cálcio, também reduz a placa bacteriana, estimula a produção de saliva e mantem a nossa boca limpa de forma natural. - Contém uma grande quantidade de ácido fólico, tornando-se assim um alimento essencial durante a gravidez. - O queijo também favorece a produção de leite materno em gestantes. - O queijo ajuda a fortalecer o sistema imunitário, aumentando assim as nossas defesas contra a doença. - O alto teor de vitamina B no queijo torna a nossa pele melhor. - O queijo diminui os sintomas da Síndrome Pré-menstrual. - O queijo é uma grande fonte de ácido linoleico conjugado (CLA), relacionada com a prevenção de certos cancros, tais como o do cólon. - É muito rico em proteína, que ajuda a construir e a recuperar a massa corporal, o que o torna um alimento perfeito para atletas ou pessoas que querem ganhar peso de forma saudável

Sign in with Google Continue with Facebook Login using other methods Ten years ago, on this day, Ronda Rousey and Miesha Tate went up against each other in their highly anticipated rematch at UFC 168 in December 2013.
While Tate escaped two submission attempts in the first two rounds, Rousey ultimately won the fight via third-round submission to retain her bantamweight title. In the aftermath, 'Rowdy' infamously refused to shake her opponent's hand.
Expand Tweet Rousey and Tate shared one of the most fierce rivalries in MMA, and they are widely credited with bringing women's mixed martial arts to the UFC. Their rivalry began at Strikeforce, where Rousey won the 135-pound title against 'Cupcake' at Strikeforce: Rousey vs. Tate in March 2012.
After the UFC absorbed fighters from the now-defunct promotion, Rousey was made the inaugural bantamweight champion, considering she held the title at Strikeforce. After defending her championship twice, she was booked against Tate for a second time after weeks of trash-talking and exchanging personal insults. As mentioned, 'Rowdy' successfully beat her rival again.
While their fight was undoubtedly an entertaining affair, what stuck out to fans was Rousey's refusal to shake hands with Tate after winning the fight. Her unsporting attitude didn't sit well with fans, with many slamming her for it.
After the MMA-based X handle, @MMAHistoryToday, reminded fans of the infamous incident that occurred ten years ago today, many flocked to the comments section to express their thoughts.

title: Dix personnes secourues après un écrasement dans les Territoires du Nord-Ouest | JDM
text: Dix personnes secourues après un écrasement dans les Territoires du Nord-Ouest Dix personnes ont été secourues, jeudi, après avoir passé la nuit auprès de la carcasse de leur avion qui s’est écrasé dans les Territoires du Nord-Ouest mercredi. L’appareil, un Twin Otter de la compagnie Air Tindi transportant huit passagers et deux membres d’équipage, s’est écrasé vers 12h45, heure locale, près de la mine de diamants Diavik, à plus ou moins 300 km au nord-est de Yellowknife. Un porte-parole de l’armée canadienne, David Lavallée, a confirmé à divers médias jeudi que les 10 personnes ont été retrouvées saines et sauves au matin et ont pu être évacuées, elles pourront ensuite être réacheminées ailleurs, vraisemblablement vers Yellowknife. Plusieurs ont subi des blessures jugées mineures, a ajouté l’officier. Le président d’Air Tindi, Chris Reynolds, a expliqué aux médias du groupe NNSL qu’il ignorait la cause de l’écrasement et que celle-ci fera l’objet d’une enquête du Bureau de la sécurité des transports. La boîte noire de l’avion a d’ailleurs pu être récupérée, a-t-il dit. L’armée avait envoyé mercredi soir un avion de transport Hercule C130 survoler la zone de l’écrasement. Malgré certaines difficultés en raison des forts vents, l’appareil est finalement parvenu à parachuter deux infirmiers militaires qui ont pu venir en aide aux rescapés. Une équipe de sauvetage partie de la mine Diavik s’est aussi rendue sur place. «Nous avons reçu des communications toutes les deux heures pendant la nuit de la part des techniciens de l’équipe de sauvetage sur la condition de tout le monde et sur la météo», a raconté M. Reynolds, en soulignant que trois hélicoptères avaient quitté Yellowknife pour se rendre à la mine et, éventuellement, ramener tout le monde dans la capitale du territoire.
